qas.question: What can be used to model tension forces?

answers.text: ideal strings that are massless, frictionless, unbreakable, and unstretchable

qas.question: What do you use to let idea strings switch direction?
In what way do idea strings transmit tesion forces?
What is the final effect of adding more and more idea strings to a load?

answers.text: the tension force on a load can be multiplied
tension force on a load can be multiplied

qas.question: What can increase the tension force on a load?

answers.text: connecting the same string multiple times to the same object through the use of a set-up that uses movable pulleys,
connecting the same string multiple times to the same object through the use of a set-up that uses movable pulleys

qas.question: What forces can be modeled using ideal friction strings?
What forces can be modeled using ideal mass strings?
Ideal strings transmit what delayed forces?

context: <b5_0><b6_0>Tension<b6_0/><b5_0/> forces can be modeled using <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3>ideal strings<a0_0/> that are massless<a0_2/><a0_1/>, frictionless, unbreakable, and unstretchable<a0_3/>. They can be combined with <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3>ideal pulleys<a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, which allow ideal strings to switch physical direction. Ideal strings transmit <b7_0>tension<b7_0/> forces <a2_1><a2_3>instantaneously <a2_2>in <a2_0>action-reaction pairs<a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> so that if two objects are connected by an ideal string, any force directed along the string by the first object is accompanied by a force directed along the string in the opposite direction by the second object. By <a4_1><a4_3>connecting the same string multiple times to the same object through the use of a set-up that uses <a4_0>movable pulleys<a4_3/><a4_0/>,<a4_1/> <a3_2>the <a3_3>tension force on a load can be multiplied<a3_3/><a3_2/>. For <a4_2>every string<a4_2/> that acts on a load, another factor of the tension force in the string acts on the load. However, even though such machines allow for an increase in force, there is a corresponding increase in the length of string that must be displaced in order to move the load. These tandem effects result ultimately in the <a3_0><a3_1>conservation of mechanical energy<a3_1/><a3_0/> since the work done on the load is the same no matter how complicated the machine.
